Background.data_info: For those with quality of teaching being high (A=1), the probability of rainfall being high (D=1) is 0.8565. The probability of quality of teaching being low (A=0) and rainfall being low (D=0) is 0.0489. The probability of quality of teaching being high (A=1) and rainfall being high (D=1) is 0.3270.

Questions.Instruction: Consider the probability of sufficiency (PS) of quality of teaching on rainfall.
Questions.Question: Given that quality of teaching was low and rainfall was low, what is the upper bound of the probability that rainfall would have been high if the quality of teaching had been high?

Calculate P(D=1|do(A=1))
P(D=1|do(A=1))=P(D=1|A=1)=0.8565
